summary: The captain marvel misogyny argument is dumb
title: The captain marvel misogyny argument is dumb
body: Like everyone is praising Alita Battle Angel, which has a female lead that is a “strong woman”. She doesn’t really appeal to the “male gaze” either. Yes this is not played by a real actor, but come one, the same thing happened with wonder woman. Maybe, just maybe it’s not misogyny, but people dislike condescending twats.

reblog.comment: Like everyone is praising Alita Battle Angel, which has a female lead that is a “strong woman”. She doesn’t really appeal to the “male gaze” either. Yes this is not played by a real actor, but come one, the same thing happened with wonder woman. Maybe, just maybe it’s not misogyny, but people dislike condescending twats.

trail.content_raw: Like everyone is praising Alita Battle Angel, which has a female lead that is a “strong woman”. She doesn’t really appeal to the “male gaze” either. Yes this is not played by a real actor, but come one, the same thing happened with wonder woman. Maybe, just maybe it’s not misogyny, but people dislike condescending twats.
trail.content: Like everyone is praising Alita Battle Angel, which has a female lead that is a “strong woman”. She doesn’t really appeal to the “male gaze” either. Yes this is not played by a real actor, but come one, the same thing happened with wonder woman. Maybe, just maybe it’s not misogyny, but people dislike condescending twats.

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

summary: Brie Larson Responds to Captain Marvel Smiling Controversy: "It's a Depiction of the Female Experience"
title: Brie Larson Responds to Captain Marvel Smiling Controversy: "It's a Depiction of the Female Experience"
body:
Brie Larson Responds to Captain Marvel Smiling Controversy: “It’s a Depiction of the Female Experience”

Captain Marvel actress Brie Larson, who will play Carol Danvers, in the upcoming film recently addressed the Captain Marvel smiling controversy.

For those unfamiliar with the Captain Marvel smiling controversy, Larson and Marvel Studios were criticized after the release of the first trailer because her character didn’t smile with people describing her facial expressions as wooden.

Is Brie Larson…

View On WordPress

summary: Ambientada en 1995, Captain Marvel sigue a Carol Danvers, ex piloto de combate de la Fuerza Aérea de los EE. UU., mientras se...
body:
Ambientada en 1995, Captain Marvel sigue a Carol Danvers, ex piloto de combate de la Fuerza Aérea de los EE. UU., mientras se convierte en uno de los héroes más poderosos de la galaxia y se une a Starforce, un equipo militar de élite de Kree, antes de regresar a casa con nuevas preguntas sobre su pasado y su identidad.

La Tierra está atrapada en el centro de un conflicto intergaláctico entre dos mundos extraños.

Checa los nuevos pósters de personajes:

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

Captain Marvel rodará en los cines el 8 de marzo.

Nuevos pósters con los personajes de Captain Marvel Ambientada en 1995, Captain Marvel sigue a Carol Danvers, ex piloto de combate de la Fuerza Aérea de los EE.

summary: Shazam Comes To The Rescue Of Captain Marvel
title: Shazam Comes To The Rescue Of Captain Marvel
body:
Fanboys and internet trolls are a way of life and if you enter the superhero genera of movies and TV they are inevitable.  For the past 10-years Marvel has experienced the luxury of not having to face any angry wrath of negative reviews from either set, until now.

Recently, the internet and Rotten Tomatoes has faced the wrath of angry fanboys and trolls over their latest entry into the MCU in Cap…

View On WordPress

blog.title: Craig Sheldon
blog.description: I write about films for @thefilmagazine and @CultVultures.

summary: From Captive Maiden to Captain Marvel - The Rise of the Female Action Hero
title: From Captive Maiden to Captain Marvel - The Rise of the Female Action Hero
excerpt: Captain Marvel is Marvel Studios' first female superhero movie lead, but it has been a long time coming. Craig Sheldon chronicles the development of female action heroes in Hollywood film.
description: With Captain Marvel just around the corner, join me as I examine the rise of the female action hero.

reblog.comment: With Captain Marvel just around the corner, join me as I examine the rise of the female action hero.

trail.content_raw: With Captain Marvel just around the corner, join me as I examine the rise of the female action hero.
trail.content: With Captain Marvel just around the corner, join me as I examine the rise of the female action hero.

summary: Brie Larson y el equipo de 'Capitana Marvel' nos presentan la primera película del UCM protagonizada por una mujer
title: Brie Larson y el equipo de 'Capitana Marvel' nos presentan la primera película del UCM protagonizada por una mujer
body:
Capitana Marvel ha aterrizado en Londres por todo lo alto con su premiere europea ¡y allí estuvimos! Arropada por su protagonista indiscutible, Brie Larson, y figuras de la talla de Samuel L. Jackson o Jude Law, la primera película de Marvel protagonizada por una superheroína promete cambiar las reglas del juego dentro de este popularísimo género de películas.

¿Y cuál es el poder secreto con el que Carol Denvers se lanzará a la batalla de la cartelera el próximo 8 de marzo? Según los directores de Capitana Marvel, Anna Boden y Ryan Fleck, la combinación de gran fuerza y enorme complejidad que hace único al personaje…

Vídeos relacionados:
Jean Reno estrena 4 latas, su primera película en español: “Era muy importante para mí”
Melissa McCarthy estrena la película que la llevó al Oscar: “No leo críticas porque no creo que vayan a ayudarme”
Felicity Jones: “Espero que con el efecto de #MeToo comience a haber un cambio”
